page.title: 06An American Visitor-Tuffley
page.content:
After just one week of my short stay at Grange Junior School, I have been greatly impressed by what I have seen. The people are friendly and helpful. The transport system is efficient, though I have not yet plucked up the courage to go upstairs on a double- decker bus. The streets are narrow, the cars are many, yet everyone travels with ease. Drivers are courteous to each other and to pedestrians. Cyclists are allowed plenty of room. The buildings are wonderful, the new mixing in well with the old. The older areas have been preserved well. The parks are quiet and beautiful. Roses seem to thrive everywhere. I imagine that I will always remember the sight and scent of the roses.
Jeanne Schwaller. (Wisconsin)
